title: Dilly Deviled Eggs
directions: Put the eggs in a medium saucepan and cover with water to about an inch above the eggs.
Cover the saucepan and bring to a full rolling boil over high heat. Leaving the cover on the pan, remove from the heat and let stand for 17 minutes.
Drain the eggs and then cover them with ice cold water. When the eggs are cold, peel under running water. See some tips for peeling hard-cooked eggs below.

Slice the eggs in half lengthwise and set on a platter or egg plate. Scoop the yolks into a medium bowl. With a fork, mix the yolks with three tablespoons of mayonnaise, chopped pickle, onion, if using, pickle juice, dill weed, and mustard. Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed. If desired, add more mayonnaise.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon dried dill (or 1 teaspoon fresh finely chopped dill)
Salt and black pepper to taste
